label.text: Rainwater Harvesting
Boribun owns a farm in southern Thailand. She has made an earthwork to improve her farm. Earthworks are structures made from soil.
These diagrams show the design and purpose of this earthwork.
before earthwork
soil
flow of rainwater
construction of earthwork
trench
soil moved to make mound
finished earthwork after several years
groundwater
One information source Boribun is considering is an educational online channel about rainwater harvesting hosted by a farmer in Kenya.
The other sources Boribun is considering relate directly to the region in Thailand where Boribun’s farm is located.
Explain why a source of information about rainwater harvesting in other parts of the world could also benefit Boribun.
Boribun is looking for information about earthwork design.
She considers the sources listed below.
Select one of these sources of information that is relevant to Boribun.
a local non-profit guide about the construction of earthworks
an educational online channel about rainfall harvesting hosted by a farmer in Kenya
a water conservation expert from a local university
a short social media video by a tourist called ‘Visiting Thai Farms’
a news article about rainwater harvesting in Thailand
Explain why this source is relevant to Boribun.
Boribun wants to know about the most recent scientific research on water conservation.
Which one of these sources is most likely to have the most recent scientific research findings on water conservation?
a local non-profit guide about the construction of earthworks
an educational online channel about rainfall harvesting hosted by a farmer in Kenya
a water conservation expert from a nearby university
a short social media video by a tourist called ‘Visiting Thai Farms’
a news article about rainwater harvesting in Thailand
What is the function of the earthwork?
In your answer, explain why the earthwork might be necessary.
